sub_title: Production and Exploration Geologist at Shell E&P
summary:
Production and exploration geologist (PhD) with 12 years of experience in the oil and gas industry. Currently production and exploration geologist at Shell E&P. Previously production geologist with Petroleum Development Oman (PDO) seconded by Shell, for the sustainable exploration and production of hydrocarbons in the Sultanate of Oman. Previously specialist carbonate geologist in Shell  E&P for the characterisation of reservoirs, seals and source rocks of the company’s worldwide portfolio. PhD in carbonate geology and Master in natural hazards from the University of Geneva.
Project leader with track record of successful deliveries. Strong sense for identifying and maturing attractive opportunities and proposing profitable and safe field developments. Presentations to executive boards leading to investment decisions. Technical authority for geology and seismic disciplines, assurance of safe and cost-effective projects and well proposals. Teaching and coaching skills.
Upstanding and resourceful person, scientific mind-set, able to collaborate with other disciplines and to lead integrated teams for delivering adequate solutions to geology and energy related opportunities

profile_positions.title: Production and Exploration Geologist at Shell E&P

profile_positions.description:
* Applied geology: Excellent knowledge of the different domains of applied geology, emphasis on carbonate sedimentology and diagenesis, reservoir characterisation, stratigraphy, structure, faults and fractures, dynamic of fluids notably, and associated characterisation tools.
* Exploration and production of subsurface fluids: 12 years of experience with Shell and PDO. Contribution to the exploration and development of tens of reservoirs across the world and notably to the generation of a country-wide portfolio of resources for the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC). Mastery in Play-Based Exploration concepts, in the interpretation of seismic and petrophysical log data, in core and plug description, in the creation of 3D static models of reservoirs and in designing exploration and production wells.
* 3D modelling: Expert in 3D static reservoir modelling (Petrel®) integrating seismic, well, log and rock petrophysical data, and in generating and maintaining subsurface and surface data bases (ArcGIS®, Spotfire®, Office®, etc.). Integration of DFN realisations into static models and dynamic simulations.
* Technology: In depth experience of subsurface characterisation tools, such as seismic, petrophysical logs, dynamic data (pressure, rate), cores and plugs, and tools used for the characterisation of rocks, such as SEM and TEM, CT scanner, petrophysical lab measurements, fluid inclusion analyses, isotopes, etc.
* Project leader: Track record in delivering business-oriented solutions to integrated projects on time and budget. Front End Development Manager (FEDM) from opportunity identification to first investment decision (FID). Presentation of results to executive boards leading to investment decision.
* Technical assurance: Geological and seismic technical authority for integrated projects and well proposals. Notably assured the technical and safe content of 50+ well proposals per year in challenging subsurface environments (H2S, faults, overpressure).
profile_positions.title: Production and Exploration Geologist at Petroleum Development Oman

profile_positions.description:
• Carbonate geologist with mastery in sedimentology, diagenesis and stratigraphy of carbonate rocks (PhD)
• Conducted and contributed to studies for field exploration, appraisal and development worldwide, e.g.: Iraq, Saudi, UAE, Albania, Italy, Egypt, Algeria, Namibia, Malaysia, Papua, etc. with business trips in the contries
• Excellent knowledge of the Middle East geology, expertise level about the Arab Fm and the Mishrif/Natih Fm
• Expert in reservoir characterisation including petrographical observations with seismic, log signatures and petrophysical properties (RCAL, SCAL, MICP)
• Unique knowledge of mechanical stratigraphy of fractured carbonate reservoirs
• Expert in developing geological conceptual models and building Petrel static models
• Specialist in analytical studies linked to complex carbonate fields, i.e. fluid inclusions, bitumen, isotopes, etc.
• Technical coach of young hires and experienced staff in asset teams
• Recognised for delivery of high quality and fit-for-purpose work on time and on budget, (co)authored 20+ internal and external publications
profile_positions.title: Specialist Carbonate Reservoir at Shell E&P

profile_positions.description:
• Focused on microporous reservoirs in the Middle East, as scope of PhD study.
• Described cores and outcrops characterised by microporous carbonate rocks (notably within the Mishrif, Shuaiba, Kharaib and Yamama Fms) integrating macroscopic and thin-sections observations with log signatures and RCAL data.
• Made special analyses with SEM, TEM and X-Ray EDS in order to understand the formation of fine-grained carbonate rocks.
• Created conceptual models to predict the distribution of microporosity in carbonate reservoirs and steer the static modelling efforts of a field in production (Qatar).
• Taught several courses (carbonate sedimentology, structural geology, mapping, etc.) for master and bachelor students, co-organised field trips for students, led 2 master works.
• Published 4 scientific papers in open journals and made 5 presentations in international conferences.
profile_positions.title: Carbonate Geologist
